page.title: 09BRITISH TELECOM RESEARCH
page.content: The main objective of the work at the Laboratories is to give customers better services at lower cost.The scope of the research is wide and varied. Silicon Integrated Circuits - there are facilities to fabricate intigrated circuits using NMOS, CMOS and ECL techniques. Custom-intigrated circuits with up to 30,000 transistors on a single chip have been produced. A computer-aided design system has been developed to utilise these advanced silicon technologies. Galliun Arsenide devices - Specific circuit designs for high-speed digital systems are being developed and the use of gallium indium arsenide material is being studied. Optical Communications-British Telecom has led the world in developing fibre technology with it's double crucible process.
